qas.question: What was special about St Mark's Basilica in Venice?
When was the latest addition to the facade at St Mark's Basilica in Venice?
the Cathedral of Orvieto has a mosaic facade, done first in which century?
the Basilica di San Frediano in Lucca has a large golden mosaic facade depicting which figure?
The Cathedral of Spoleto is signed by who?

context: Sometimes not only church interiors but <a0_0>façades were also decorated<a0_0/> with mosaics in Italy like in the case of the St Mark's Basilica in Venice (mainly from the 17th–19th centuries, but the oldest one <a1_0>from 1270–75<a1_0/>, "The burial of St Mark in the first basilica"), the Cathedral of Orvieto (golden Gothic mosaics from <a2_0>the 14th<a2_0/> century, many times redone) and the Basilica di San Frediano in Lucca (huge, striking golden mosaic representing the Ascension of <a3_0>Christ<a3_0/> with the apostles below, designed by Berlinghiero Berlinghieri in the 13th century). The Cathedral of Spoleto is also decorated on the upper façade with a huge mosaic portraying the Blessing Christ (signed by one <a4_0>Solsternus<a4_0/> from 1207).
